intro: Platystemon californicus var. ciliatus, commonly known as the California flatstem, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and umbel-shaped flower clusters. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climates. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. The variety *ciliatus* is distinguished by its hairy or ciliated leaf margins, which contribute to its unique botanical appearance.
